content.description: sit start, up left on the left leaning arete topping out left
content.location: This is the outcrop that is just below the downhill edge of the powerline clearing. It can be approached from Balcony Rock or from the powerline clearing. see the old beta map.

content.description: Sit start, crimps on a face left of the left leaning arete.
content.location: This is the outcrop that is just below the downhill edge of the powerline clearing. It can be approached from Balcony Rock or from the powerline clearing. see the old beta map.

content.description: Jump start with right side pull to reach the large ledge on the left side of the boulder. Roll up to a jug and top out to the right.
content.location: Scramble left past Pit Shine until you see the cave slightly uphill on your right.

content.description: climb up the face
content.location: East of The Cove

content.description: Sit start on the rail and top out the face of the boulder using fun slopers. Oddly challenging lowball.
content.location: Continue left past Quartz Cavern to a discontinuous band of rockfall about 100 feet into the woods. This boulder is near the top of that band.

content.description:
Sit start on the quartz ledge inside of the minicave. Problem trends right through a series of flakes under the roof before topping out to the left on bomber quartz crimps. 

  A bit of an eliminate, avoid use of the side walls of the cave for the full grade.
content.location: Continue uphill from Cosmic Revolution. This climb is at the far end of the same band of rock.

content.description: start on the really nice sloper and work left and then up to top out. Great climb.
content.location: see beta photo

content.description: This is a face/slab down in a slot.
content.location: It's very close to the Cove. Basically stand on top of the Portal and turn around and you will see the pit area.

content.description: Sit start on the 2nd horizontal crack from the ground below the only major vertical crack on the rock face. Problem was named Pancake after a flat hand jam moved needed to make the send go at the prescribed grade.
content.location: On the slightly overhanging orange wall between Pit Shine and Cosmic Revolution.

climbs.name: Orange You Going to Warm Up

content.description: Sit start on the 2nd horizontal crack from the bottom where the rock is stained black. Dyno/deadpoint the finger buckets and top out.
This route heads up and then leans right. There are variations to be done off of this route.
content.protection: Top rope anchors off of trees or Trad it up.
content.location: This route is obvious as it splits the wall. (see photo, a crash pad sits at the base or the route in the photo)

climbs.name: May The Quartz Be With You

content.description: Start on the rounded sloper of The portal, climb right to exit at nearly the same place as Crash Quartz in Crimping. This line moves diagonally up right. We used a vertical quartz seem below the top to make our final move to the lip and top out.
content.location: In the Cove in the Outlying Area on Elk Ridge

content.description: Start in the obvious horizontal crack and move up and left over the bulge to top out.
content.protection: Crashpad (steep landing, use spotter if chance of falling)
content.location: Continue left past Quartz Cavern to a discontinuous band of rockfall about 100 feet into the woods. This boulder is near the bottom of that band.

content.description: If only this problem were much bigger, or you were much smaller. A superb problem for a kid and a fun problem for an adult. Beautiful (but very short) arete.
content.location: See the old beta map for location

content.description: sit start, beginning on the dish hold that gives Dish Network its name. Then move left to the arete on crimps. When you get to the arete use holds on the left and on the right side and work your way up the arete to top out.
content.location: This begins the same as "Dish Network" on a short overhaning face beneath a slab but you move left to the arete rather than going up the slab.   This is the outcrop that is just below the downhill edge of the powerline clearing. It can be approached from Balcony Rock or from the powerline clearing. see the old beta map.

content.description: Your left hand starts on a great dish on the overhang. The right hand has a few options from matching to being crossed under on other holds. Move up to the slopers on the lower slab. Then, move up to the slightly incut crimper on the slab and rock upward to get a grip with your right hand and then stand up and climb out.   It's the same sit start same as "Duped..." but go straight up onto the slab.
content.location: This is the right most problem in the area and begins at the base of a slab but on a short overhanging face.   This is the outcrop that is just below the downhill edge of the powerline clearing. It can be approached from Balcony Rock or from the powerline clearing. see the old beta map.

content.description: sit start, follow the lip of this block to the left edge and mantle up
content.location: This is the outcrop that is just below the downhill edge of the powerline clearing. It can be approached from Balcony Rock or from the powerline clearing. see the old beta map.

content.description: Crimping on quartz veins.
content.location: see beta photo

content.description: ss, move out left to crimps from under the roof then up
content.location: see beta photo

content.description: Begin underneath the arete/overhang on a giant undercling. Move up to the sharp arete/fin feature and then move to up until a jug on the arete. Make a long move up to a peach colored face with a incut crimper rail and then move to the lip jug. You can roll straight out on the slab if you want the full value problem or you can trend up around to the right and top out using the right edge of the slab.
content.location: see beta photo

content.description: Stand start in the cave matched on the cool openhanded hold with the triangle incut. Transition under the choke stone and work your way out the sloper ledge on the right side of the roof until you can move left onto the face of the boulder and top out.
content.protection: Crashpad. An additional spotter pad for inside of the cave is recommended.
content.location: Continue past Pit Shine to find the cave on your right. (same boulder as Squirrelly)

content.description: A bit of an eliminate. Dont use the ledge right of the arete, otherwise it wouldnt be as much fun.
content.location: This is the outcrop that is just below the downhill edge of the powerline clearing. It can be approached from Balcony Rock or from the powerline clearing. see the old beta map.

content.description: Sitting on the eastern shoulder of Elk Ridge is a smaller cliff, compared to Balcony Rock and Balcony Jr., with some nice routes and bouldering. The cliff is mostly of interest to climbers who are visiting Balcony Rock or Balcony Jr. and are seeking another set of short routes with easy top rope setup. The cliff is about 30 feet tall or shorter, with numerous juggy lines and one really nice right leaning crack.  It faces south.
